pros: My coworkers were great and supportive. The pay is better than Mercy and Affinity. It was also close to my home.
cons: The atmosphere is toxic. Not only is everyone terrified to make a mistake, the managers are constantly playing the blame game and looking to penalize people for the tiniest mistake. Don't be fooled by this hospital's prestigious reputation. It is demoralizing to work there. And no, I wasn't fired; I quit.

pros: Stable employment for the most part. It takes a lot to get fired. Benefits are ok but definitely not amazing for a large health care provider. Hours are decent.
cons: Inefficiently run where unproductive people are allowed to hang on forever basically. People who have seniority are given positions in departments they know nothing about creating a huge drag. Cooperation among departments is not good. Glass ceiling on lower levels and they will hire outside with no consideration of qualified people already there. Benefits are mediocre. ALSO, no raises in 5 years.

job_title: RN Case Manager Home Health Care in Canton, OH
pros: Opportunity for overtime always available, mileage is paid at government rate
cons: Heavy caseload (acuity more so than amount of patients) with little office support, charting is like you are in the hospital and it can be excessive, be prepared to chart at home, CM are to see 6 a day and visit nurses see 8, office and field staff tend to not see eye to eye about anything and little consideration is taken for your home life needs

job_title: STaff Registered Nurse in Dover, OH
pros: The staff is great to work with and makes the work enjoyable.  The working hours are typical of a level II trauma center, as call is required of the job.
cons: The working environment leaves a lot to be desired.  The atmosphere is not about teamwork, as the younger generation has come onboard.  Favoritism is shown for the younger employees, and the older employees are not valued.

review_title: It is great to work with caring local employees  in a community hospital.
pros:
Great coworkers! Most departments work well together. Because it is a community nonprofit hospital, the administration is concerned about the employees. The pay is pretty good.

You can roll some PTO over. After a year or two, a lot of people end up cashing out PTO.
cons:
May be called off in 4 hour increments without compensation. Example: Regular shift is 7AM to 7 PM. At 6 AM You could get a call saying "We don't need you at 7 AM. Call back in at 10:30." You call back at 10:30 and if the don't need you, you are still waiting to see about 3-7PM.  If you do need to go in it's at straight time, even if you're driving there for 4 hours.  You either accept no pay for your unplanned time off or use PTO to get paid.

Another point of contention for people with less than 10 years, you may not be able to schedule any decent time off. Many workers have been there a long time and schedule first. If you have kids and want time off with them in the summer, well.... You can find others to cover for you, but then you are not allowed to use PTO.

review_title: Aultman captures the essence of good, sound healthcare.
pros: The atmosphere that Aultman provides to work in is great..Your colleagues are all very helpful and hospitable. The salaries are good, the hours reasonable. I don't see any reason why a doctor, nurse or any other worker should NOT work here.
cons: Honestly i cannot think of any reasons not to work here..Maybe the paychecks aren't as good as some of the other hospitals like MERCY maybe but thats about it..and sometimes the hours can be unreasonable for interventionalists and emergency personnel.

pros: It's great working for a place that listens to me, and where my voice matters!  These ICU nurses love taking care of the sickest patients and working with the doctors, RT, PT and all the people it takes to get the patients better and moving again!
cons: The unit could be bigger, with more rooms for more patients. They would have no problem filling those rooms with sick patients!

pros: decent health insurance,  that's about it
cons: pay is not even close to what it should be and raises if you get one are tiny, the constant increase in insurance wipes it out. Mangers are in interested in advancing good employees, most have no interest in it..so you are stuck. Simply put just go else where, its not what it was 5 or 10 years ago. Its really sad..everyone is leaving

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Canton, OH
pros: Community hospital, co-workers willing to help out when busy. Staff are friendly and go out of their way to help patients. There are many openings so there is room to move around in the company.
cons: Many agency nurses who are not invested in the hospital or community.  Magnet status should be reevaluated. Instead of fixing problems, they put bandaids on issues. Constantly dealing with urgent issues without being proactive or considering the consequences of their hasty changes. Taken away many perks over the years. Raises do not cover the health insurance hikes every year.

pros: On site fitness center if you're interested in fitness, they have their own insurance, tuition reimbursement available
cons: Insurance can be a little pricey, wage freezes, sometimes advancement throughout the facility can be difficult, numerous unnecessary jobs seem to becoming created

review_title: There are other places that are better to work as APRN

review_title: Very good company to work for.
pros: Vacation time and sick time are good, 3% match on 401k, they encourage a healthy environment where you are encouraged to workout a little during your work time to stay mentally fit and physically fit.
cons: Different shifts constantly changing.  Outsourcing jobs and doesn't make us feel safe and secure as employees. Healthcare benefits are not up to standard.

pros: Although the Aultman Health Foundation employs over four thousand people, there is a sense of community more commonly found with a smaller organization.  There are numerous opportunities for advancement, and furthering your education is highly encouraged.  The benefits are decent, and their Bee Healthy program is a great incentive toward overall wellness.
cons: As with most companies, "who you know" seems to win out over competency.

pros: Reliable employment, never had a layoff within the organization. Coworkers are willing to help each other whenever they can.
